abstract: 3M, the manufacturing conglomerate, says it has agreed to pay $230 million in cash for an Israeli company that makes technology used to keep track of people.
snippet: 3M, the manufacturing conglomerate, says it has agreed to pay $230 million in cash for an Israeli company that makes technology used to keep track of people.
lead_paragraph: 3M said Tuesday that it had agreed to buy Attenti Holdings, an Israeli supplier of technology to track people remotely, for $230 million in cash.
